result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven W J Wroten

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Steven W J Wroten appeared by phone.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for Steven W J Wroten.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Klopp has not had much time to speak with the defendant regarding the offer or the discovery; requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Steven W J Wroten appeared by phone  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22FO94 tracking with 22CF75:
Court notes that the paperwork wasn't turned in.  Defendant paid money but hasn't turned in the paperwork yet.

BY THE COURT:  Court appoints Atty Jeanne Zamzow.
Repay Attorney fees
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Steven W J Wroten appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF75 & 22FO94 tracking together:
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has the paperwork.  
BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on 22FO94.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Court will appoint Atty Zamzow once the paperwork is received
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven W J Wroten appeared by video. 
22FO94 tracking with 22CF75:
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives the reading. Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and did not qualify for Public Defender appointment; asks for a court appointed attorney.  Defendant states that the PD office is mailing the paperwork and asks for Atty Jeanne Zamzow.

BY THE COURT:  Court will appoint Atty Zamzow
Payment Plan:  $250.00/month commencing on August 1, 2022
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven W J Wroten appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Allison Markoski appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. Defendant has not called the Public Defender's office yet but will be doing so.  
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
